page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The Darenth/Bean area is largely rural with grassland and woods. There are distinct residential settlements served by shops, schools, public houses and churches. The area is rich in minerals and consequently there are quarries where chalk is extracted for the cement-making process. The cement industry has a significant impact on the local economy but there is concern amongst local residents about the ecological effects of any further extension of quarrying. Whilst some adults work in the local cement and paper-making industries, many commute to London. There is a relatively high level of unemployment due to the closure or modernisation of local manufacturing industries.
